# nibrsr

The goal of nibrsr is to work with data from the FBIâ€™s [National
Incident-Based Reporting System](https://cde.ucr.cjis.gov/).

## Installation

You can install the development version of nibrsr from
[GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r
# install.packages("pak")
pak::pak("higherX4Racine/nibrsr")
```

## Example

# Package index

## Glossaries

- [`GLOSSARY_OF_PARENT_POPULATION_GROUPS`](https://higherx4racine.github.io/nibrsr/reference/GLOSSARY_OF_PARENT_POPULATION_GROUPS.md)
  : Categories of containing geographic areas in the NIBRS
- [`GLOSSARY_OF_POPULATION_GROUPS`](https://higherx4racine.github.io/nibrsr/reference/GLOSSARY_OF_POPULATION_GROUPS.md)
  : Categories of geographic area in the NIBRS
- [`TYPES_OF_WEAPONS`](https://higherx4racine.github.io/nibrsr/reference/TYPES_OF_WEAPONS.md)
  : Weapon categories in the NIBRS

## Extract data from archives

- [`extract_agencies()`](https://higherx4racine.github.io/nibrsr/reference/extract_agencies.md)
  : Read details about agencies from an NIBRS archive
- [`extract_incident_weapons()`](https://higherx4racine.github.io/nibrsr/reference/extract_incident_weapons.md)
  : Load weapon information from an NIBRS archive
